title: The Doctor addresses retaliating with toxic behavior

replies.body: http://www.quotehd.com/imagequotes/authors48/doctor-who-quote-the-very-powerful-and-the-very-stupid-have-one-thing.jpg
“In the end the Party would announce that two and two made five, and you would have to believe it.”

i love that book
i read it on my spare time in 8th grade
very deep meaning that i'm pretty sure i wasn't able to fully comprehend and i still probably can't full comprehend the deep level of meaning that the book has.  But i understand enough of it so that I can leave it knowing that i learned something.
What's its name?
1984-George Orwell

aw you beat me to it
was at school all day
http://img.pandawhale.com/post-17263-Doctor-Who-Upvote-gif-Each-one-3Umv.gif
That's one way to censor a dildo.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

Damn, really hits hard when you realize how much the Doctor's probably seen.

This guy isn't talking wisdom or philosophy, it's from *experience.*

(listens to the doctor, considers the worth of firing the first shot, then shrugs and shoots the doctor to kill him)

"First blood! Now I can buy another {{item:1055}} after I kill two minions! Why did I even second-guess myself?"
You do realize the writers will just find a way to regenerate him, right?
Forget toxic players, these are wise words for life in general.
You complete me.

Michael Scott's response to toxic players
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dshYwrxzIWg
Wise words.  If only we can try to think calmly in action.

This moment was one of the most memorable in Doctor Who history. He knows every consequence of acting hastily, of waging war, of taking that first shot when you could just sit down and resolve it without needless violence. I'm pretty damn sure that Zergara was reconsidering her opinion there.

> This moment was one of the most memorable in Doctor Who history. 

didn't this episode just come out 3 days ago? how can it be memorable?

Being memorable has nothing to do with age. It might be too early to *judge* it as memorable, but that doesn't mean it is or isn't.

Elvis was a brilliant performer long before he'd been around enough for people to recognize that.
+2 for Peter Capaldi and the message, he's so cool.
I hate to be that guy(no, not really) but how many lives have been shattered by angsty teens furiously tapping their keyboards while breathing heavily during internet fights?
Uhm... Isn't that guy from blade runner?
Haven't seen this episode yet since i passed out with a flu bug but im looking forward to watching it this saturday on the rerun. Love 12 <3

There's so much passion in his acting (imo). I've been listening to Whovian friends for a while now but just started watching this season and am hooked, so got a free month of Netflix to binge watch from the start (of the new series).

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=oz2EbOvN,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2015-11-10T05:11:54.154+0000)
>
> There's so much passion in his acting (imo). I've been listening to Whovian friends for a while now but just started watching this season and am hooked, so got a free month of Netflix to binge watch from the start (of the new series).

By far, Capaldi has been the best at showing the dark side of the Doctor, the war-torn veteran who has seen more than most can handle in several lifetimes. You can see the tears well up in his eyes as he recalls his War Doctor days, when even he himself insists he was not The Doctor.

oh yess! good for you dude. This has been a pretty darn good season so far- Capaldi is def my second fav. 11 is classic that cant be beat though. you may fall in love with 10 but 11 is definitive of the doctor imho. sorry didnt mean to bring up nerdy discussion about this!
AS a doctor who fan, all my love. and GOD this speech was epic.

Not fond of the new Doctor, sorry but he's just not doing it for me- still gonna stick with the series but honestly I liked almost anyone more than the new guy.
Robin Hood, Santa Claus- hell, Clara's boyfriend were all liked more by me than the new Doctor.
He wasn't charismatic from the start, and then he was given a guitar to be more relatable, and it now makes him look more dumb.
